articles.title: Reunion of Separated Families from North and South Begins
articles.content:
Reunion of Separated Families from North and South Begins
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The reunion of separated families and relatives from the north and the south started at Mt. Kumgang Resort on Saturday under an agreement reached between the Red Cross organizations of the north and the south to arrange the reunion on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day according to the proposal made by the DPRK side on its own initiative.
					 Those from the north side first had group reunions with separated families and relatives from the south side.
					
					 After the start of the reunions, the families and relatives from the north hugged their kith and kin from the south whom they have longed to see. 
					
					 Those from the north side told their kith and kin from the south about the worthwhile life they have led under the Korean-style socialist system centered on the popular masses in which all the people have formed a big harmonious family under the care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Red Cross of south Korea hosted a banquet for the separated families and relatives from both sides on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Great King of Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Great King of Cambodia
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Norodom Sihanouk, the great king of Cambodia, on his 88th birthday.
					 Kim in the message said the Korean people regard and sincerely respect the great king as a prominent statesman and a close friend as he has greatly contributed to the independence and development of Cambodia, the prosperity of the Khmer nation and the development of friendly relations between the DPRK and Cambodia and wished him good health and happiness.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Barbados
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Barbados
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Freundel Stuart on his appointment as prime minister of Barbados.
					 The message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to favorably develop, wishing the prime minister success in his future work for the country's prosperity and people's well-being.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Cuban Vice FM
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Cuban Vice FM
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of Cuba Marcos Fermin Rodriguez Costa who visited the DPRK extended positive support to the Korean people in their dynamic drive to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation.
					 Giving his impression of the DPRK, he said:
					
					 The Korean people have achieved great successes in their efforts to build an economic power under the leadership of the great Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 I was deeply impressed to see the Korean people pushing ahead with the socialist economic construction while frustrating the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK with the might of Songun.
					
					 Visiting the E-Library of Kim Il Sung University, I was convinced of the rosy future of the DPRK.
					
					 The successes achieved by the DPRK instill great strength and courage into the Cuban people.
					
					 The Korean people have positively supported the Cuban people in their cause.
					
					 The peoples of the two countries will always be together in the struggle to foil the moves of the imperialists and attain their common goals. 
					
					 Noting that he felt the warm friendship of the Korean people toward the Cuban people while staying in the DPRK, he continued:
					
					 The long-standing friendly relations between the two countries are developing favorably.
					
					 This year marks the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between Cuba and the DPRK. 
					
					 The Cuban people will boost the friendly ties with the Korean people. 
					
					 I express full support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle.

articles.title: Gift from Egyptian Figure
articles.content:
Gift from Egyptian Figure
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Youssef Amin Wali, vice-chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt, congratulating him on his reelection as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea at its Conference.
					 The gift was handed to an official of the DPRK embassy in Cairo on October 25.

articles.title: Gifts from Chinese
articles.content:
Gifts from Chinese
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by Feng Yila, daughter of Feng Zhongyun, a person related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in China, and a veteran fighter of the former Chinese People's Volunteers, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the entry of the CPV into the Korean front.
					 The gifts were handed to an official of the DPRK embassy in Beijing on October 25.

articles.title: Artistes' Sports Contest Held
articles.content:
Artistes' Sports Contest Held
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The 41st sports contest among artistes was held at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Saturday.
					 The participants were divided into the groups representing cinematic art, theatrical art, education and production field. They competed in various events such as football, basketball, volleyball, track and field, group forced march and tug of war.
					
					 They fully displayed the high technique, spirit of collectivism and noble moral traits they have acquired through mass sports activities in every event.
					
					  The group of cinematic art placed first in the contest in group standing.

articles.title: National Soccer Tournament Ends
articles.content:
National Soccer Tournament Ends
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Soccer matches held at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang from October 7 came to an end on Thursday. The tournament took place as part of the National Sports Festival to mark the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 The Mangyongbong Sports Team finished the first in both men's and women's matches held on the round-robin and knockout basis.
					
					 Prizes of morality went to the boys and girls of the Myohyangsan Sports Team and prizes of best player, excellent player, top scorer and best goalkeeper to male and female players of different teams who distinguished themselves in the tournament.
					
					 The tournament served as a good occasion in developing the nation's football techniques.

articles.title: New Mechanical Pencil Produced
articles.content:
New Mechanical Pencil Produced
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- A new model of mechanical pencil has been produced by the Pyongyang Mechanical Pencil Factory.
					 Its trademark is Chotuijong that means first agenda.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung had the pencil issue put on the agenda at the First Session of the Provisional People's Committee of North Korea held on February 20, Juche 35 (1946).
					
					 At the session, he raised the pencil issue not just as a businesslike matter but a very important political one related to the education of children and, furthermore, to a desire of the Korean people. He also took strict measures to start the mass-production of pencils as early as possible.
					
					 True to his intention, the factory has produced many kinds of pencils in the past.
					
					 The new model, called automatic pencil, is well received by schoolchildren. When a lead is used up, extra ones come out automatically, and the lead is tough.  
					
					 The plastic pencil is very low in the production cost for nonuse of nonferrous metal.
					
					 Pak Kum Song, manager of the factory, told KCNA it had reconditioned the comprehensive processing lathe to replace some ten automatic lathes, and built the new pencil production process equipped with a CNC-based lead drying process in seven months or little more.
					
					 The factory also produces different kinds of ball-point pens, gel ink pens and color pencils.

articles.title: S. Korean Ruling Forces' Confrontation Policy toward DPRK Bound to Go Bust
articles.content:
S. Korean Ruling Forces' Confrontation Policy toward DPRK Bound to Go Bust
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean ruling forces' anachronistic and criminal "policy toward the DPRK" is bound to go bust as it stirs up and escalates distrust, confrontation and tension between the fellow countrymen to an extreme phase.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The said policy is a traitorous confrontation one running diametrically counter to the inter-Korean joint declarations and an anti-reunification one denying dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south. 
					
					 The south Korean conservative group blustered that "it is impossible to improve the inter-Korean relations with chauvinist nationalism," malignantly slandering the idea of "By our nation itself", the basic idea of the north-south joint declaration, as "anachronistic one", a "narrow-minded nationalism" and the like. It completely blocked the cooperation undertakings, shouting itself hoarse that the south "would not be dragged by the north without principle" and "it would counter the north with principle even though it may spend five years without dialogues" and the like, pursuant to its criminal "policy towards the north". 
					
					 The above-said policy is nothing but a policy of confrontation and war aimed to realize its criminal design for achieving the "unification of systems".
					
					 The "policy towards the north" pursued by the south Korean conservative authorities is, in essence, designed to realize their wild ambition for achieving "unification under liberal democracy."
					
					 Ever since its seizure of power the south Korean conservative group has persistently kicked up a racket for confrontation between systems, desperately denying the ideology and system of fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 All the Koreans who ardently desire national reconciliation, unity and reunification and prosperity common to them will not allow the south Korean authorities to go on with the above-said policy hamstringing the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should roll back their policy for escalating the confrontation with the DPRK, the policy going against the demand of the era and desire of the fellow countrymen, and opt without delay to mend the inter-Korean relations if they do not want to face a severe judgment by history and the nation, concludes the article.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Anti-reunification Jargon Slammed
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Anti-reunification Jargon Slammed 
 Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive recently let the prime minister make a "policy speech" at the National Assembly. In the speech Lee Myung Bak again pulled up the DPRK, asserting that "the first step to be taken to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve peaceful reunification is to build a peace community through the denuclearization of the north" and the like. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is nothing but an anti-reunification jargon which can be let loose only by those who desperately pursue confrontation challenging the sincere efforts of the DPRK to pave the way for improving the inter-Korean relations through dialogue and cooperation and going against the trend of the times. 
					
					 The above-said "policy speech" once again revealed the true colors of his group as traitors persistently pursuing the confrontation between the north and the south while going against the need of the era and the desire of the fellow countrymen. 
					
					 The "denuclearization" touted by the south Korean ruling forces is by no means aimed to repair the inter-Korean relations and preserve peace. 
					
					 This is proved by "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars", the "policy toward the north" which they have followed since their coming to power, and the present grave reality of the inter-Korean relations, its product.
					
					 It is impossible to improve the inter-Korean relations nor is it possible to defuse the danger of a war to the Korean Peninsula as long as the south Korean authorities persist in their nuclear campaign against the DPRK to hurt fellow countrymen in collusion with foreign forces. 
					
					 No matter how noisily the south Korean authorities may trumpet about "denuclearization," while frantically kicking up the disturbing nuclear racket against the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces, no one would lend an ear to their rhetoric. 
					
					 If the south Korean chief executive truly wants the improved inter-Korean relations and peaceful reunification, he should make a prompt switchover in his anachronistic anti-reunification confrontation policy and opt for giving momentum to the hard-won atmosphere of dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south.
					
					 This is the first step to be taken by the south Korean authorities to mend the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: S. Korean Military Authorities' Illegal Move to Increase Military Spending Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Military Authorities' Illegal Move to Increase Military Spending Flayed 
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Confederation of Trade Unions and other civic and public organizations grouping people of various circles in south Korea held the 106th meeting for peace and disarmament in Seoul on Oct. 26.
					 Speakers at the meeting recalled that the defense budget proposal for next year submitted by the military authorities to the "National Assembly" is the biggest in history as it showed a 5.8 percent increase over that for this year.
					
					 They charged that the proposal includes many illegal financial allocations such as expenses for boosting the south Korea-U.S. combined defence capability, expenses for improving the military facilities and those for building amusement facilities to be used by officers and specified persons.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that it also includes a budget for building a depot for stockpiling reserve ammunitions needed for carrying out a scenario for mounting a preemptive attack upon the north, they noted, and went on:
					
					 The above-said facts go to prove that Lee Myung Bak and the "Grand National Party's" trumpeting that the budget for 2011 was shaped for the sake of a "fair society" and the common people is no more than hypocrisy.
					
					 They urged the military authorities to retract the illegal move to increase the military spending and the NA to pay heed to the demand of the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Projected Large-scale War Exercises under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Projected Large-scale War Exercises under Fire
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The command of the first field army of the south Korean puppet ground force made public on Thursday that it would stage the 2010 Hwarang Exercises in the area of south Korean Kangwon Province from November 1 to 5, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 These madcap war exercises for a war of aggression against the DPRK will reportedly be aimed to "round off the strong integrated defense position" of the civilians, the government, the army and police with at least 17,000 persons of the three services, reserve forces, administrative institutions and police involved. 
					
					 This announcement came in the wake of the publication of a plan made by the 36th Infantry Division of the puppet ground force to stage a field mobile training in the area of south Korean Kangwon Province in the same period with a large force and huge combat equipment involved. This brings to light the reckless scenario of the puppet warmongers to ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK at any cost.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed in Italy and Russia
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Observed in Italy and Russia
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- A meeting and a photo exhibition took place in Italy and a film show was held in Russia on Oct. 20 and 22 to congratulate General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his reelection as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 65th birthday of the WPK and mark the 30th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
					 On display in the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and publications and photos on the Korean people's efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the country. 
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The secretary of the Rome Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of Italy said that the reelection of Kim Jong Il as general secretary of the WPK not only provides a sure guarantee for carving out a rosy future of the DPRK and achieving national prosperity but gives great courage and hope to the world progressive political parties and peoples in their struggle for socialism.
					
					 He praised Kim Jong Il as a brilliant thinker and theoretician and a political elder who has protected the sovereignty and dignity of the Korean people and developed the WPK into an ever-victorious iron-willed party and turned the DPRK into a political and military power and a socialist bulwark.
					
					 He expressed support and solidarity with the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and reunify the country.
					
					 The secretary general of the Italian Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea noted that the Korean people's struggle for reunifying the country will surely culminate in frustrating the vicious moves of the U.S. imperialists and their allied forces and winning a victory. 
					
					 The participants of the film show watched the Korean film "Mt. Chilbo".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ethiopia
Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was brought out in booklet by the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea.
					 The work, published on Oct. 2, Juche 84 (1995), reviews with pride the glorious history of the WPK in which it explored a new way of building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and serves as an immortal great programme for party building and activities as it indicates the way for developing the WPK into an eternal party of the President.
					
					 A book releasing ceremony was held in Addis Ababa on Oct. 25.

articles.title: Iniciado encuentro de familiares y parientes separados
articles.content:
Iniciado encuentro de familiares y parientes separados 
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 30 en el monte Kumgang el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados del Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					　Gracias a la iniciativa de parte norcoreana, las entidades de la cruz roja de ambas partes acordaron realizarlo con motivo de Chusok (15 de agosto lunar, fiesta folclorica). 
					
					　Ante todo, los familiares y parientes norcoreanos se reunieron colectivamente con sus consanguineos surenos.
					
					　Ellos se abrazaron e intercambiaron el saludo con sus consanguineos que anoraban tanto. 
					
					　Los entrevistados del Norte hablaron a sus consanguineos del Sur de la vida feliz de que disfrutan ellos mismos en el sistema socialista al estilo coreano centrado en las masas populares donde todo el pais forma una gran familia armoniosa bajo el regazo del Dirigente Kim Jong Il. 
					
					　Este dia, la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea ofrecio un banquete en honor de los familiares y parientes separados de ambas partes.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim envia mensaje a su homologo barbadense
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim envia mensaje a su homologo barbadense
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ATCC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Yong Rim, envio el dia 28 un mensaje de felicitacion a Freundel Stuart, premier de Barbados por su nombramiento a este cargo importante.
					  El remitente desea al destinatario exitos en su labor ulterior para la prosperidad del pais y el bienestar del pueblo y expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises continuaran desarrollandose favorablemente.

articles.title: Clausurado torneo de futbol del Festival Deportivo Nacional
articles.content:
Clausurado torneo de futbol del Festival Deportivo Nacional
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo terminado el dia 28 en el capitalino Estadio  Kim Il Sung el torneo de futbol del Festival Deportivo Nacional en homenaje al 65o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea que habia sido inaugurado el dia 7.
					  Este torneo transcurrio en forma de clasificatorias por grupos y eliminatorias centrando la atencion de los especialistas y aficionados.
					
					  Los equipos masculino y femenino de Mangyongbong ocuparon el primer lugar en sus respectivos sexos.
					
					  Los equipos de Myohyangsan de ambos sexos recibieron el premio moral, los jugadores y jugadoras de varios equipos, que han sobresalido en los encuentros, recibieron los premios que se conceden al jugador, goleador y portero mejores y al excelente jugador.
					
					  El torneo marco un hito para promover el desarrollo de la tecnica de futbol del pais.

articles.title: IVXI juegos deportivos de artistas
articles.content:
IVXI juegos deportivos de artistas
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 30 en el Estadio Kim Il Sung los IVXI juegos deportivos de los artistas, divididos en las ramas de cinematografia, escena, educacion y produccion.
					　Se realizaron las competencias de varias disciplinas como futbol, baloncesto, voleibol, atletismo, marcha forzada en grupo y lucha de la cuerda.
					
					　En todos los partidos los jugadores demostraron bien la alta tecnica, el espiritu colectivista y las nobles cualidades morales que han ejercitado a traves de las actividades deportivas de las masas.
					
					　En la ocasion el dominio de cinematografia ocupo el primer lugar en la clasificacion general.

articles.title: Clausurado festival deportivo nacional por 10 de octubre
articles.content:
Clausurado festival deportivo nacional por 10 de octubre
Pyongyang, 30 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurado el dia 29 en el Centro de Baloncesto del Reparto Chongchun el Festival Deportivo Nacional en homenaje al 65o aniversario de la fundacion (10 de octubre) del Partido del Trabajo de Corea que habia sido inaugurado el dia 15.
					 En el certamen fueron establecidos nuevo record mundial en la disciplina del tiro en trinchera del colectivo femenino.
					
					　Ademas, se establecieron los records nacionales en las especialidades del tiro, tiro al arco, atletismo y levantamiento de pesas.
					
					 En la competencia de futbol los jugadores de ambos sexos del Conjunto Deportivo Mangyongbong ocuparon primeros lugares y en la de baloncesto, los jugadores del Conjunto Deportivo Kigwancha y las jugadoras del Conjunto Deportivo Amnokgang, respectivamente.
					
					 Ademas los jugadores de ambos sexos del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril se clasificaron primeros en el voleibol.
					
					　En la ceremonia de clausura estuvieron presentes el jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Yong Su, y otros funcionarios y deportistas.
					
					　La palabra de la ocasion estuvo a cargo del ministro de Deportes Pak Myong Chol.
